name: King’s Bounty: Legions
description: King’s Bounty: Legions is vibrant, well thought-out 3D online strategy game with turn-based combat in a vast and diverse game universe. Head into a world full of magic, wondrous creatures and wicked monsters. Become a knight, forge armor in the smithy and gather an invincible army!

reviews.review_text: I love the King's Bounty games, I really do. But King's Bounty: Legions just doesn't feel right. All of the elements that made the previous games interesting were removed or tweaked to provide the most bland and generic experience possible to the player.  In this game, there is no specialisation, you can spend your gold on marginal upgrades for units and spells, but cost scaling and level requirements for these upgrades is made in such a way that you can't just decide to dump all your gold into spells and rely on them. Especially since you can't learn spells, you have no mana, you have to buy scrolls, every time you use a spell you need to use a scroll.  When it comes to army building, there isn't much to it unless you are willing to pay, you have access to some basic units from shops, and a few advanced units as quest rewards, but only enough to show you what these units can do and encourage you to purchase more at the real money shop. You just don't get the satisfaction of doing your best with limited resources like you did in the previous games, especially since morale mechanics and most of the units special effects were removed.  Finally, you don't have to select your battles like in the previous games, here you simply progress from one area to another with the ability to grind when you feel you aren't strong enough to take on the next challenge.  The only thing that's left from the previous games is the turn-based gameplay, which just isn't enough to hold the game together without the strategic elements that the previous games had.

I can't recommend this game, but you might like it.  The game-play itself is actually pretty fun, and the combat is decent enough. However, this game  constantly  tries to get you to use Facebook to get / share extra rewards with friends. And it makes it feel like a facebook game. That little fact, above all else, absolutely ruined this game for me.  However, the game is free, and like I said, it can be pretty fun. If you're broke and looking for a turn-based strategy, this could be a great little time waster for you! I don't think you  lose  anything by not connecting with facebook, but you will be annoyed by the constant requests to do so (at the end of every quest / battle).  Honestly, the devs made a decent game. I'd love to give it more of a chance, but the whole facebook thing just throws me off. If you don't think that something like that would bother you, you should totally check this game out.  5/10. Wonderful game absolutely ruined by Facebook Nagging.

I'm kind of saddened by this game. After the wonderful Armored Princess, Crossworlds, and North King's Bounty games, Legions comes in with not much changed graphically. What they have changed, though, is that it is now Free to Play. While I am fine with this in general, this is one of those F2P changes that feels wrong given what the game is about. In the past games, you could in theory stack your army with very powerful units (although a low number since your character level and thus 'Leadership' is low) if you won early battles and knew where to recruit. Replacing this deep and interesting mechanic are paid 'Starter Packs', which are not nearly as diverse or interesting as a custom crafted army, or you can buy Booster Packs or units with real money.   Even this state of affairs could have been remedied if I had some early access to a wide variety of units, some of which would be the higher tier units. This is simply not the case almost 10 hours into the game. I am stuck either rolling the 2-3 strongish units (even though my Leadership could support 6-7), or having to constantly spend gold on a very sparse selection of troops to replace heavy losses from crappy troops. I mean, I shouldn't have to buy Archers as my only replenishable ranged choice. At least open it up so I can recruit any low level archer.  I really hope the devs go back, do a proper update of the engine, and release a game for $20 and remove the game killing mechanics that support the F2P model. It just doesn't work for King's Bounty.  You're better off buying the earlier games.

Having played Heroes of Might & Magic and original King's Bounty, this game looked like fun. Even though I knew it was free and I know that any developer doesn't work for free, I expected better than I got.  No matter what you are being told otherwise, this game is pay to play. It is one step worse than pay to win. Even though it looks like you could progress through the game in the early stages, sooner than later you'll run into the problem of having to grind the same levels all over, just to get some low-tier creatures. Forget about the higher level or even the legendary. You need them to win, but you'll be lucky if you get them from a lucky chest or as an in-game reward.  Eventually you'll get stuck, having a mediocre army, mediocre artifacts and nothing left to do other then to grind the same levels over and over again.  The PvP sucks as well. You might get lucky if there are players roughly on your level, but you could just as easily be paired with either a very high-level opponent or someone who put cash into the game and easily kicks your ♥♥♥♥.  Story is almost non-existing. Spells are limited in usability, fight-map is too small. The game is also pretty slow, in having to always load (maybe synching with the servers?).  In the end, I just deleted this game (level 22) and just re-installed HoMM5.
